text: Update: Bootstrapping of databases and updated registering user code has been committed. Working on getting test cases written and committed.
Update: Completed FAB-836 (CreateToken and VerifyToken) for the case of ECDSA. Working on RSA case.
Update : Finished CrytoUtil function and JSON processor for FAB 266. Finishing up TCERT client generation part.
Here is an overall update from the membership services squad:

•	COP Makefile & COP CLI

•	COP server runs listening via HTTP/REST

•	COP client enroll working

•	COP client register almost complete

o	Database work (postgres, sqllite, and mysql)

•	Progressed on tcerts, but not yet

•	Defined API for config update for peer, orderers, & CRLs (see FAB-807)

Next

•	Complete register & tcerts & token authorization
•	Running COP server in cluster behind haproxy
Created today, Estimated 2 days, No Assignee and marked as `Done` ?
For example, is there any code/doc or any sort of output ?
<@U1KJY9BJQ>: is this the related code? If so, let’s link between the JIRA to gerrit…

____
I have just revisited all the /ca code submissions… we should really have a JIRA item in each gerrit (“Pull Request”), same as the policy for code submissions we used with github...

It’s OK to have a few gerrit items pointing to one JIRA (say, if you want to break it down (and submit via a few changesets separately), or so - one can just state “This changeset is part of the work needed to accomplish…/fix FAB-XYZ", but we should `not` have gerrit submissions with `no` JIRA items.
